name: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions.
In a pan, cook the pancetta until crispy.
In a bowl, beat the eggs and mix with grated pecorino cheese.
Add garlic to the pan with pancetta, then remove the garlic and add the cooked spaghetti.
Remove from heat and mix in the egg and cheese mixture.
Season with salt and pepper and serve.

name: Chicken Stir-Fry
instructions: Slice the chicken breast into thin strips.
In a large pan, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add garlic and ginger, and cook for 1 minute.
Add chicken strips and cook until browned.
Add bell pepper, carrot, and broccoli to the pan.
Pour soy sauce over the mixture and cook until vegetables are tender.
Season with salt and pepper and serve.

name: Budget-Friendly Fried Rice
instructions: Heat the vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add the beaten eggs and scramble until fully cooked. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, add the cooked rice and stir-fry for a few minutes.
Add the mixed vegetables and soy sauce, and cook until heated through.
Return the scrambled eggs to the pan and mix everything well.
Season with salt, pepper, and top with green onions before serving.

name: Hearty Chili
ingredients: 1 can (400g) kidney beans, drained and rinsed
1 can (400g) black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and garlic; cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add bell pepper and ground beef, cooking until the meat is browned.
Stir in diced tomatoes, kidney beans, black beans, chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce heat to low and cook for about 20-30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve hot, topped with shredded cheddar cheese, a dollop of sour cream, and sliced green onions.
